articleContent.title: Chord: 9th in G (Shape: C)
articleContent.content:
# Chord: 9th in G (Shape: C)

## Brief Presentation
The 9th chord in G (Shape: C) is a beautiful and lush chord that adds color and sophistication to your music. It consists of the notes G-B-D-F-A, creating a rich harmonious sound that can enhance your chord progressions and melodies.

## Notes and Intervals
- G: Root 
- B: Major 3rd
- D: Perfect 5th 
- F: Minor 7th
- A: Major 9th

## Musical Flavor and Usage
The 9th chord in G (Shape: C) has a jazzy and smooth quality to it. It is commonly used in jazz, R&B, funk, and soul music to add a sense of sophistication and richness to chord progressions. This chord can create a dreamy and atmospheric vibe when used in ballads or slow tempo songs.

## Songs
Here are three songs that feature the 9th chord in G (Shape: C) prominently:
1. **"Fly Me to the Moon" by Frank Sinatra**: This jazz standard prominently features the 9th chord in G (Shape: C) in its chord progressions, adding a sophisticated and romantic touch to the song.
2. **"Don't Know Why" by Norah Jones**: This contemporary jazz-pop song uses the 9th chord in G (Shape: C) to create a mellow and expressive musical atmosphere.
3. **"Kiss of Life" by Sade**: In this R&B ballad, the 9th chord in G (Shape: C) is used to enhance the smooth and soulful feel of the track.
